item.title: Katie add a quote by Mark Batterson
item.description: "If you're bored, one thing is for sure: You're not following in the footsteps of Christ." -- Mark Batterson

item.title: Katie add a quote by Sam Levenson
item.description: "For Attractive lips, speak words of kindness. &emsp;For lovely eyes, seek out the good in people. &emsp;For a slim figure, share your food with the hungry. &emsp;For beautiful hair, let a child run their fingers through it once a day. &emsp;For poise, walk with the knowledge that you never walk alone. &emsp;People, more than things, have to be restored, renewed, revived, reclaimed, and redeemed. Remember, if you ever need a helping hand, you will find one at the end of each of your arms. &emsp;As you grow older, you will discover that you have two hands, one for helping yourself and the other for helping others." -- Sam Levenson

item.title: Katie add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "A little nonsense now and then, is cherished by the wisest men." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Katie add a quote by Winston Churchill
item.description: "Tact is the ability to tell someone to go to hell in such a way that they look forward to the trip." -- Winston Churchill

item.title: Katie add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "If things start happening, don't worry, don't stew, just go right along and you'll start happening too." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Katie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "The homemaker has the ultimate career. All other careers exist for one purpose only - and that is to support the ultimate career. " -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Katie add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Katie add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "We sleep safely at night because rough men stand ready to visit violence on those who would harm us." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Katie add a quote by Mother Theresa
item.description: "I know God won't give me anything I can't handle. I just wish he didn't trust me so much." -- Mother Theresa

item.title: Katie add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Nothing in this world is harder than speaking the truth, nothing easier than flattery." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Katie add a quote by Audrey Hepburn
item.description: "Nothing is impossible, the word itself says 'I'm possible'!" -- Audrey Hepburn

item.title: Katie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I am trying here to prevent anyone saying the really foolish thing that people often say about Him: I’m ready to accept Jesus as a great moral teacher, but I don’t accept his claim to be God. That is the one thing we must not say. A man who was merely a man and said the sort of things Jesus said would not be a great moral teacher. He would either be a lunatic — on the level with the man who says he is a poached egg — or else he would be the Devil of Hell. You must make your choice. Either this man was, and is, the Son of God, or else a madman or something worse. You can shut him up for a fool, you can spit at him and kill him as a demon or you can fall at his feet and call him Lord and God, but let us not come with any patronizing nonsense about his being a great human teacher. He has not left that open to us. He did not intend to." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Katie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Katie add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "When I'm good, I'm very good, but when I'm bad, I'm better. " -- Mae West

item.title: Katie add a quote by Fyodor Dostoyevsky
item.description: "To love someone means to see them as God intended them." -- Fyodor Dostoyevsky

item.title: Katie add a quote by Brennan Manning
item.description: "My deepest awareness of myself is that I am deeply loved by Jesus Christ and I have done nothing to earn it or deserve it." -- Brennan Manning

item.title: Katie add a quote by Eugene O'Neill
item.description: "Why am I afraid to dance, I who love music and rhythm and grace and song and laughter? Why am I afraid to live, I who love life and the beauty of flesh and the living colors of the earth and sky and sea? Why am I afraid to love, I who love love?" -- Eugene O'Neill

item.title: Katie add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "The more that you read, the more things you will know. The more that you learn, the more places you'll go." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Katie add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "I like nonsense, it wakes up the brain cells. Fantasy is a necessary ingredient in living." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Katie add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "If you are going through hell, keep going." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Katie add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "Life is what you make it. Always has been, always will be." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Katie add a quote by Bessie Anderson Stanley
Katie add a quote by 1 Thessalonians 4:11-12
item.description: "Make it your ambition to lead a quiet life, to mind your own business and to work with your hands, just as we told you, so that your daily life may win the respect of outsiders and so that you will not be dependent on anyone." -- 1 Thessalonians 4:11-12

item.title: Katie add a quote by Charles M. Schulz
item.description: "All you need is love. But a little chocolate now and then doesn't hurt." -- Charles M. Schulz

item.title: Katie add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "If ever there is tomorrow when we're not together... there is something you must always remember. You are braver than you believe, stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think. But the most important thing is, even if we're apart... I'll always be with you." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Katie add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "Don't underestimate the value of Doing Nothing, of just going along, listening to all the things you can't hear, and not bothering." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Katie add a quote by Francis Bacon
item.description:
"<i>Ipsa scientia potestas est.</i>
Knowledge itself is power." -- Francis Bacon

item.title: Katie add a quote by Harriet Beecher Stowe
item.description: "Of course, in a novel, people’s hearts break, and they die, and that is the end of it; and in a story this is very convenient. But in real life we do not die when all that makes life bright dies to us. There is a most busy and important round of eating, drinking, dressing, walking, visiting, buying, selling, talking, reading, and all that makes up what is commonly called living, yet to be gone through…" -- Harriet Beecher Stowe

item.title: Katie add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "Lighthouses don’t go running all over an island looking for boats to save; they just stand there shining." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: Katie add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "Logic is relative." -- John Irving
